intro: Apargia annua, commonly known as the annual apargia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves that help it capture sunlight efficiently. Apargia annua is an annual species, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
